answers.answer: I have a panic attacks problem but its gotten better over the years its never affected my baby this is my fourth. Tell your Dr though.

I do and I had a post partim with my first child. I also was getting some bad once when I imagined I could be pregnant again. But finally i learnt to control those by simply accepting it, by saying its just an episode and is gonna go away and that I really want my second baby. Try your ways to control your panic, which is very typical, if you feel it's getting out of control talk to your doctor, there are healthy options.
Thank you all so much! Is there any chance of the panic attacks causing preclamsia? Bc they make me have high blood pressure. I have panic attacks like3  times a day

As far as I know, no, the high blood pressure at preeclampsia is a result of it, not the trigger. U r probably get your pressure elevated because of panic and stress, you have to put it under control though, talk to ur doctor, he/she can discuss with you how bad your panic attacks are and what can be done to reduce them.  Good luck. And remember you are not alone. Most women worry about their pregnancies, and you had a history of panic attacks, so its only" normal", but you can manage it for sure, and if you feel you need help, please talk to a specialist too. Take care.

question: Do any of you have panic disorder?? I do. I'm scared it's gonna affect my baby
title: panic attacks..
